benchmark_details.name: CHOICE
benchmark_details.overview: CHOICE is an extensive benchmark designed to objectively evaluate the hierarchical remote sensing capabilities of Vision-Language Models (VLMs) through 10,507 problems across various tasks and dimensions focusing on perception and reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically and objectively evaluate the remote sensing capabilities of large vision-language models.

data.source: Data collected manually from 50 globally distributed cities, using diverse satellite imagery and data sources.
data.annotation: Questions constructed from expert knowledge and model-driven generation with human verification.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is computed based on the correctness of responses to the multiple-choice questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of the VLMs in tackling remote sensing tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through thorough human review and systematic evaluation against multiple VLMs.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data handling procedures comply with ethical standards and privacy considerations.
